website_summaries.verdict: If removing roots is your top priority, this is an acceptable pick. But keep in mind that it may not hold up to tough roots, and it's not practical for other shoveling tasks.
pros: Patented design consists of a pointed, serrated head and 48-inch handle engineered to cut through roots and dig them up from deep soil
cons: Not as versatile as other shovels on our list
There have been reports of bending during tree root removal

customer_reviews.title: weak not tempered will bend unless digging in Sand.
customer_reviews.text: I got this shovel 4th of May I was going to use it for metal detecting. I found a deep target in my yard. I have avoided deep targets as I don't have a good shovel for deep stuff (deeper than 4 inches) I cut the plug circle about the size of a beach ball. I tried to pry it up and the blade bent like a piece of copper. I am sending it back. it looks mean and looks like it will cut through dirt with ease. well it won't it's a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Irish

customer_reviews.title: I love this shovel
customer_reviews.text: I love this shovel. I had a hip replacement in my "digging" leg so I was looking for anything to make work easier. I use it for planting and plant division. The narrow tip just cuts through all kinds of soil and roots. Why didn't someone think of this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Jana

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The shovel is welded to the handle and easily bends, would break off very easily. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Crissie

customer_reviews.title: I have never had a shovel tear through dirt like this shovel the only thing I would like some ...
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a shovel tear through dirt like this shovel the only thing I would like some kind of foot pedals it's kind of hard on the bottom of the feet other than that it's a great shovel and I would recognize it to my friends thank you
customer_reviews.author: mrmmike

customer_reviews.title: It is the best tool we have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Searched for years for a tool such as this. It never dawned on me to look on Amazon until we had some heavy duty yard work to do and couldn't find a tool that would do the job. This is my wife's tool. She is a small woman in her mid 70's. She has been dividing sedge grasses and hostas. This thing saved our loves! It is the best tool we have ever bought! Could not ever live without it!!
customer_reviews.author: richard mckinney

customer_reviews.title: I recommend buying a heavy duty sharp shooter shovel then cutting ...
customer_reviews.text: This shovel is not worth the price because it is very cheaply made and broke in half after a few uses. This is simply a case of "over promise, under deliver". I recommend buying a heavy duty sharp shooter shovel then cutting notches on the side. I could recommend this shovel if it were 1/3rd the price or more heavy duty for the price at which it is being offered.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Keck Gilman

customer_reviews.title: The shaft is great, but the head broke
customer_reviews.text: Broke in less than 2 hours work. It saws ok and goes deep with ease. Just don't put any pressure on the head. The shaft is great, but the head broke. Hoping to get a free replacement and change this review, seeing as how I've used it twice since it's purchase this month. See how it goes, arrive the company solicited feedback. Wish I had better things to say.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Ann McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Good ergonomic design but not sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.text: I like the ergonomic design and ease of digging holes for planting, BUT, after one day of using it to dig out tall weeds, it has two stress fractures along both edges about half way up and now bends when I use it. I thought I would be able to use it to dig out shrubs but it is not going to work for that. I have taken very good care of it, wiping it down and drying it off, keeping it inside the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Martha S.

customer_reviews.title: This May Be The Greatest Tool Ever, But after Too Many Requests To Review the Darn Thing, 1 Star!
customer_reviews.text: I really don't know, I have never used the tool, probably won't use it until spring or summer. Showed the picture of the tool to my wife who does most of the weeding in our flower beds and she thought it would be good to give it a try. In the meantime, the relentless emails from Amazon begging for a review prompted me to offer this one to stop the damn requests. Yeah, I understand I can opt out but I don't mind one request, it's the multiple requests for the same item that were irksome. Hopefully we will try it and like it, but it’s very unlikely I will come back and update this review.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Effective Tool for the Yard and Garden
customer_reviews.text: When the mailman left my Amazon package at my door with Root Assassin written on it, he gave me a funny look when I picked up the package. The shovel lives up to its name and really does cut thru the roots of weeds and just about everything else in its way. It is sharp edged and pointed and is effective. It is an unusual tool that serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: M. J.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for short people
customer_reviews.text: The handle is too short for me to use comfortably. I am a 6' normal guy, and I have to crouch over to use it. It's fine when the blade is above ground, but when you step on it to dig, the handle is not oven at knee level. If the handle were a foot to 18 inches longer, the shovel would work much better for me. Maybe it's fine for kids or little people, or if you sit while you dig up trees and bushes. The blade works well and cuts easily through root infested formerly planted areas, but the stub handle hurts my back so much I can only give it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: David Kline

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad ideal.
customer_reviews.text: Have been looking for something with this ideal for a while. Easy to handle. Perfect height, for me anyway. It will bonce of root and will work but takes work to cut through a 1 inch root. CON= DO NOT try to pry up stump that you are cutting root on, will bend lower potion of blade. Once bent will do little or no good. cause it will bend there everytime..I have to say that just for shoving it the ground and cutting roots, with care, will last a long time. This worked for me as a light to medium duty. Heavy duty root cutter will need to be powered.
customer_reviews.author: James Baker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tool
customer_reviews.text: Despite a lot of effort in the spring to be rid of weeds, they began to take over the yard again. This tool made all the difference in the world. I am not strong, and this tools just slides in the dirt and pops the weed right out. I then filled in holes with dirt and grass seed. The difference in the yard is amazing, and how much easier, safe, and effective this was than sprays that promise to kill weeds, but not grass. I would recommend this tool to anyone. Thank you to whoever created it and to you for selling it!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Kuhns

customer_reviews.title: Not a Good Product
customer_reviews.text: IT look great out of the box and it will slice through roots well. But don't try to do anything else than slice through roots or it will break. I was digging in clay and after about 20 minutes the shovel made a loud popping sound and it was completely bent. And the metal actually tore on the side of the shovel. Good idea, but poorly constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Fonz

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This shovel will dig out most anything. I took out a big patch of Pampas Grass ( the Copperheads love the stuff ) with very little effort. It also allowed me to remove some kind of nasty plant which grows like cancer and I haven't been able to eradicate with multiple applications of herbicide. I wish I had found this shovel sooner, it would have saved me weeks of useless effort.
customer_reviews.author: F. Clef

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy tool. Well made.
customer_reviews.text: I like this. It does what it says and is a very sturdy tool. We have the hardest compacted clay soil here in central North Carolina. It cuts through the clay soil and small roots much better than a regular shovel. My only minor complaint is the blade is narrow and cannot hold much soil but I suppose the narrow blade contributes to its digging performance, so I use this tool to slice and loosen the soil then the soil is much more easily removed with my regular shovel. No problem. It's still worth using this tool on tough soil.
customer_reviews.author: Tar Heel

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 2.5 Years of Use
customer_reviews.text: After two and a half years this shovel is useless because the blade bends in half. I have other shovels I have owned for more than twenty years so to me this is a durability and sturdiness failure.
customer_reviews.author: My02Cents

customer_reviews.title: Edge prone to damage in transit
customer_reviews.text: The shovel looks decent, and feels pretty solid. The company should re-think packaging though. The shovel arrived in a regular cardboard box (single layer, not very thin, but not thick either) without any padding. This resulted in some minor damage, which caused the edge to bend slightly and a bit of paint to chip off. I wouldn't necessarily expect that no paint would ever come off during use, but a product purchased brand new should be protected from damage. I plan to update my review with how the shovel actually performs once I actually use it in my yard, but it's a bit cold here for that right now.
customer_reviews.author: A NACU

customer_reviews.title: Good concept inferior build
customer_reviews.text: Cuts into the ground WELL. Issue comes up when attempting to lift clay, dirt out. The shovel blade bends. Not Good. If there was a T-bar channel going up the center of the blade to the shaft, welded to the shaft it would not bends. Sorry to have to state SAVE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: J R.

customer_reviews.title: Work Out
customer_reviews.text: Have used this once and found it great for a nice edging tool. It takes a lot of muscle in both directions and will give you a good work out. Would have liked the shorter version that was not available... drat. With only 27inch legs, and 5'2", this really makes me work hard being a bit oversized for my size... Going is is pretty good coming back out required rocking this tool side to side to get it out of the ground.... At 70 I am just celebrating I can still do this kind of work :) Made for someone with LONG LEGS
customer_reviews.author: picturethisone

customer_reviews.title: Best Shovel Ever
customer_reviews.text: This shovel is amazing. I was skeptical that it would work as advertized. In 10 minutes I was able to remove a small tree stump about 4 inches in diameter by hand that I had tried using a sawzall and a one ton cherry picker (motor hoist) on and could not get it to budge. After 2 passes around the stump with the root assissin I was able to rock it back and forth and then pull it out of the ground by hand!!!! Well worth the price for this stump only - Brazilian Peppers are next - they wont stand a chance.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D

customer_reviews.title: 20 years of Roots
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! We had some bushes that died and needed to be dug up. Bring a total amateur, it was impossible to dig it up with shovels. I’m always thankful for reviews on the web because everywhere I looked it mentioned the Root Assassin. After it arrived, my brother-in-law came to help. He was able to cut the roots with the tool and we used a saw for thicker roots. The bushes had been there 20 years and the roots were thick. My brother is using the Root Assassin on his bushes now. Well worth the money. $180.00 job for under $60.
customer_reviews.author: 2 in College

customer_reviews.title: worked well at first
customer_reviews.text: this shovel worked well at first but after a few uses the thin blade flexed and developed a crack on both sides. soon it will snap off the first 3 inches of the tip. I have downgraded this to 1 star. I bought this in a few months ago and have used it a few times. When they say dont pry they mean even a little bit. If I had it to do over again I would cut my plug with this because it works great for that then pry with my short spade.
customer_reviews.author: TERRY EDWARDS

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could give it more stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. We have been struggling to dug up bamboo in our yard - a really tough task, and one that is much more challenging than we thought. Tried all sorts of things to help, with little success. The rhizomes (roots) are really tough to get through, and so numerous. So when I found the Root Assassin (cool name that sounded promising) I figured for the price that it was worth a try, and had low expectations of effectiveness. I was wrong. This thing was invaluable! Digs like a shovel, cuts like a saw. Whoever designed this - well done.
customer_reviews.author: Rick B

customer_reviews.title: Really does a job on roots!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Florida, so the ground is easy to dig in, but loaded with finger width roots and smaller between the surface and a foot down. It’s almost impossible to dig through at times. Bought this after seeing it in Handyman magazine. It has alternating serrated teeth like a shark, is about 4 inches wide at the tip and gets to about 10 inches at the top of the spade. You can’t really shovel much with, but it is fantastic to do the initially digging. I am very, very happy I bought this! One comment to the shipper, the tip ripped through the cardboard and got pretty chewed up, maybe put extra cardboard around the tip.
customer_reviews.author: LISA LCSW

customer_reviews.title: Cuts right through ivy
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of ivy that I need to cut through for planting or moving and it works like a charm! Cuts through tree roots like butter and really makes things easier - wish I would have had a few years ago. The one thing is that it doesn't really dig out dirt like a regular shovel wood (you push shovel in and remove dirt) because I think it is so long and thin, and it really is used for cutting through things. I have to plant a bunch of new trees in ivy and this is going to make it a breeze to dig into the dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Runner

customer_reviews.title: Really nice metal detecting tool.
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use and cuts small roots as i dig. As a metal detecting tool, i would like something that would cut a half circle in the dirt so i could move to the other side of my hole, dig, and remove a comple plug from the ground or get a half circle plug that can be flipped back. However, i have not found such an animal. This one is probably the best detecting shovel I’ve been able to find.
customer_reviews.author: Gary V.

customer_reviews.title: Great garden tool where roots are an issue.
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly useful, this shovel will slice through small and medium roots with ease. It will also slice through your sprinkler system PVC so be careful. Having said that, if you live in a neighborhood with mature trees and bushes, this can save a ton of time cleaning up your yard or planting something new. You'll note that the tip is slender; don't try to use this shovel as a pry-bar! It's a 'cutter', not a 'lifter'.
customer_reviews.author: JoRod

customer_reviews.title: Slices through the roots, but bent first use.
customer_reviews.text: This tool works wonderfully to slice through the in-ground roots. However, mine bent immediately - it appears to be aluminum without the strength of a conventional shovel. Be ready to switch tools frequently, using this shovel to slice through the roots, and a conventional shovel to actually dig them up and pry the roots out of the ground.
customer_reviews.author: thecharcuterer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work. It's a great idea but low manufacturing quality and cheap materials make it useless. When you try to dig the thin stamped metal flexes. The blade flexing makes it impossible to dig. The blade was dipped in paint so all the teeth instead of being sharp were all rounded off.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Piper

customer_reviews.title: Hail the Root Assassin!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love my Root Assassin! Here in central Florida our property is plagued with palmettos that have a thick, intricate root system that goes to the depths of Hell. Our Root Assassin cuts right through the tough roots and pops these giant devil plants out of the ground with ease. A job that used to take 20 minutes of laboriously digging and cutting with shovel and hand axe is now accomplished in 2 minutes with one tool and very little effort.
customer_reviews.author: Jett Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Root Assassin Shovel
customer_reviews.text: My hats off to whoever came up with the design for this shovel. I have huge briar vines with quarter inch thorns that requires digging up their roots to eradicate. Even the smallest vine has a root larger than a potatoe. This shovel gets the job done getting out these vine roots. No more using a pick axe and a regular shovel for this task. The Root Assasin lives up to its name for my use.
customer_reviews.author: JStreet

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had read other reviews...
customer_reviews.text: Got here quickly and packaged well. Very nice video to see the difference between a regular shovel and this one. I was a little shocked to find that it bent backwards when I had it in the soil and tried to pry the dirt out by pushing the handle toward the ground. Granted, I'm not too familiar with shovels, but I don't recall prior shovels doing this. I hope to hear back from the manufacturer. I have already tossed the box (why would one need to return a shovel, right?) so I hope this doesn't cause a problem.
customer_reviews.author: stevedfw

customer_reviews.title: Best tool I own. Love AMLeonard
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been gardening for 60 years since I was little. Besides having the best name, the Root Assassin is the best tool I’ve used for removing weeds. It is good for roots of all sorts— long tap roots or the ball of small superficial roots. Quality tool. Tall and balanced nicely. I will buy my future gardening tools from the AMLeonard Co.
customer_reviews.author: Lee M.  MD

customer_reviews.title: It broke after 25 minutes of doing the job it was made for...
customer_reviews.text: The shaft broke off within the first 25 minutes. The first time I sank it into the ground, I could feel it bend. While it can't be used as a lever, it couldn't be used as a spade. Do not refer to it as a shovel or spade because it's not. In looking at the design, it would have worked better had it been attached like a regular shovel or spade in terms of the shaft connecting to the shovel/spade blade. It probably works great if the roots are shallow and the ground is soft.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pongratz

customer_reviews.title: great shovel
customer_reviews.text: this shovel is an absolute find to have purchased. it is strong and sturdy. it is 32 inches long and easy for me to handle working on my knees. troubles with roots before are gone. the shovel works like almost magic. I am so glad I purchased it. with a little "elbow grease" it has become my number one shovel among many others not so good for getting a hole dug easily and quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Happy, warm wife

customer_reviews.title: Not as strong as it says
customer_reviews.text: This only lasted 1/2 an hour before the tip broke off. I guess it was about 4" of the tip that came off. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Ginnybee

customer_reviews.title: Decent price
customer_reviews.text: The shovel is pretty good. The blade is strong and takes a beating. The teeth are not really that sharp and after a few dozen uses some of the teeth have dulled a bit. The shovel also did not come with the blade cover mentioned in the description. All in all it is a really good shovel. I use it metal detecting so it will be seeing a lot of usage.
customer_reviews.author: RMC

customer_reviews.title: Narrow Application
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool but has a narrow application. For what it's intended to do it's very good. Cuts through even palm roots quite well. But, even though it looks like a trenching shovel, it can't be used as one. Flexes excessively when used to pry and I fear destroying it if used roughly.
customer_reviews.author: shuuto

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last...
customer_reviews.text: I used this for about a month before it developed a crack on the side which eventually made it unusable. Very disappointing because I thought the steel would make it stronger than the other fiberglass models out there... This one actually broke quicker than those. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie D.

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy shovel head
customer_reviews.text: This shovel did not meet expectations. It was purchased to prune small banana sprouts to thin the stand, which are a very soft plant o cut through, but the shovel head bent on the first use. The shovel head is not heavy duty and there is no way this could cut through tough tree roots. I am very disappointed with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Taaroa

customer_reviews.title: Digging Joy.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the finest shovels for metal detecting. The serrated edges cut through roots, turf and soil easily and saves your back and time on your knees. The blade width and length is just right and overall length makes it easy to carry and transport. The handle saves on your hand and offers a great grip.
customer_reviews.author: G. Timothy Daniel

customer_reviews.title: do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered this several months ago and just recently used it for the first time a few days ago, to dig out a plant with roots very similar to horseradish. I was stunned to find it was not very strong - the blade actually got bent digging this plant up. I expected it to be much sturdier for the price I paid. Unfortunately, the time for me to return it is past...or believe me, I would. Very disappointed and would never recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon M. Kirby

customer_reviews.title: A shovel that fails the bend test
customer_reviews.text: If you use this shovel for anything but punching lines like with edging then you will be disappointed, I use this to dig trenches when repairing Irrigation about 3 feet down and it doesn't even have enough leverage to pull up on, extremely disappointed on durability as others stated Paint and the middle of the shovel will bend and deform then out will probably be a liability on flinging into your face with it's serrated angles
customer_reviews.author: Julius D.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shovel to cut thru roots when edging beds and it did not do what is was designed to do. I own cutting shovel that I bought for same price and they do the job way better. The round tip I think is designed to roll off the root so the teeth cut into the root but it doesn’t work well. It is very flimsy and wants to bend as well. It may be ok for light use or very small roots but does not live up to its name as the “root assassin” very disappointed with my expensive purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this root assassin shovel to dig a trench in order to pull out bamboo roots. It does an amazing job getting into dry, thick, clay soil, and the teeth pulled up the thick bamboo roots. I am using a sawzall rather than the shovel to cut the roots because they are more than 2 inches thick, but just pulling the roots out is a huge help that no regular shovel could do. The smaller roots in the soil are being cut by the shovel with ease. This is an amazing tool to use. Glad its now part of my tool collection.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: If you have an area with roots to dig you can't beat this shovel!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I'd had this years ago. I have a lot of trees and this rips though the thick mesh of tiny roots like nothing I've ever seen. It can't cut the bigger ones but I didn't expect it to. I used to have to stand on a regular shovel and then jump on it to dig what this one will do with only one foot on it. I'm seriously impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice design. Poor blade strength.
customer_reviews.text: The shovel is nice and compact with a large handle. The teeth on the side of the shovel blade and intense and appear to function as described. The issue I have is the blade strength. I used it for first time yesterday and was mildly disappointed. The blade greatly flexed under minimal strain. Is it supposed to bend like that?? Is mine just defective?? I would consider other options if you plan on digging in anything but loose soil.
customer_reviews.author: Richard T. Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing tool. The minute it arrived I went out and dug a hole where many tree roots grew. It sliced throught tangles of roots that choke my plants. Then I tried it on a tree branch. I'm not very strong and it was really easy to saw through the branch. Now I keep looking around for other branches I can cut. Nice not to have to ask my husband to do it!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Heney

customer_reviews.title: Saved me $180 after my first use!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 72 yr. old woman who was tired of having to pay $180 each time I had a leak in my lawn irrigation system because I could not dig down to the pipes because of the roots! I bought the Root Assassin 32" mini shovel and WOW! It cut right through the tree roots and I am now able to fix the irrigation pipes if they break in the future! This is a great product and has already saved me $180! Thank you for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Wise Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Efficient Tool for Everyone
customer_reviews.text: My go to tool in the garden. This little gem has replaced me lugging around three or four tools. I love the fact that it has a long handle and saves me from the back breaking of bending over to get the little roots that go everywhere. Chop, Dig, and the are gone , and Iam able to get out larger stumps than I had an originally anticipated. Very good construction, I will have this for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Reyannan

customer_reviews.title: Great for general garden use.
customer_reviews.text: as a deep and narrow digging tool this is excellent. On grass roots it's also a beast, but as any sort of tree root at all it leaves a LOT to be desired, and the cutting edge is very minimal. Better off digging up the root you want and cutting it with a hacksaw or sawzall. Still, excellent for general garden use, just don't expect to dig up those tiny trees or stumps with it. It's a struggle to cut any root larger than 1/4-1/2".
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Makes quick work of separating perennials.
customer_reviews.text: I order the root assassin because I have perennials to separate and clay soil with lots of rocks. The shovel slides through the roots easily and I can cut up the roots in manageable pieces and pry them out with a garden fork. I would not use this shovel as a pry bar as I think that would bend it. Using after a rain in clay when it is soft is the best way to make it work like cutting through butter. I have recommend it to my friends three have sent for it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Creager

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for cutting roots but handle is weak
customer_reviews.text: Works very well to cut through roots. You place side edge of tool against root to be cut, and dig in against the root. Sawtooth edges on tool cut roots easily. Use side to side motion to maximize cut. Made two passes around large azalea stump then used two shovels to pop large root ball out of ground. Worth the money! One week later the handle bent easily as I was doing sideways motion as written earlier. I was not using as pry bar. I have initiated return
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Karlen

customer_reviews.title: too much for too little
customer_reviews.text: the only thing it assassins is your wallet , it is as dull as a butter knife , the teeth are blunt and likely good on grass only , used it here in Florida (aka sandy soil) and the tip bent , seriously ? Do your self a favor and just buy a regular long shovel .
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shovel head too long
customer_reviews.text: This shovel seemed like it would be answer to my prayers b c I have so many strong roots in the way of planting. The problem is that in order to saw through the roots I have to dig really deep and my soil is very hard to dig in. So I have to first get through the hard soil and by the time I do, the roots are already bashed up. I'm sure that if I had good soft soil though, that it would be just the ticket.
customer_reviews.author: Emilie

customer_reviews.title: Tip not strong enough fro heavy weed tubers.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product once with terrific initial results--until the tip of the shovel blade bent on a weed root tuber. I was going to order another one and I checked the warranty and it is supposed to be for life so I am hoping Amazon will help out a little here.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Millen

customer_reviews.title: Bye Buckthorn!
customer_reviews.text: This shovel just rocks! We have loads of buckthorn and they're a pain to dig up but it's necessary. This shovel is fantastic for digging up the whole root ball. Much easier than using a weeding tool or a hand trowel. This is a real keeper and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mencke

customer_reviews.title: I really ‘dig’ this tool
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job, very solid and strong as it doesn’t bend with even considerable lever pressure. Cuts through smaller roots, but over an inch in diameter sawing technique was necessary. Worked really great to break up thick old grass sod so I could remove smaller chunks.
customer_reviews.author: foto-u

customer_reviews.title: Man Sized
customer_reviews.text: The implement looks like it would really do the job - if it weren't so big and heavy. It is 48 inches and so, as a 62 inch female it is difficult to use. I hope in the future they produce a smaller, lighter version. In fairness I must say that it is very sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Siesta

customer_reviews.title: Works great on big nasty weeds with strong roots!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shovel because I needed to remove a bumper crop of thistle (the PA state flower - but it's a noxious weed, go figure), which is a prickly awful plant with a pretty deep root that doesn't pull easily. I couldn't find a weed extractor that went deep enough - until I found the Root Assassin! Used it for the first time last night, and it made short work of at least 30 thistle invaders!
customer_reviews.author: AYM

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS SHOVEL.......
customer_reviews.text: I am a female person who loves to garden and has way more flower beds than a rational person would ever attempt to manage. This shovel evens up the odds a bit that, at the age of 71, I might still be able to dig holes and move my established perennials over to that new bed that I was insane enough to add..... Sadly age didn't developed wisdom or brains.......
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Too tough to get through clay type soil
customer_reviews.text: I have hardened clay soil with tree roots in abundance, so thought this shovel would be a dream to use. Nope. It stops when it hits a root, and then you have to shift the blade to get to the root and "saw" it. Well, easier for me to dig with a sharp shovel and then use my loppers to cut roots. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: tallahasseelass

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far excellent. Goes through soil easily -edges are not knife sharp or thin like end of well used shovel that’s kept sharpened . Time will tell how it holds up & sharpens. I do like the short length ... I’m 5’1” with spine & lower back degenerative diseases, so the light weight really helps. I need to use it more in different soils to really critique it.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Cracked blade
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shovel for digging through roots, however blade bends very easy and is now cracked. Pretty much worthless. Bent with minimal prying force.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Dietz

customer_reviews.title: This shovel is a good one works well
customer_reviews.text: This shovel is a good one works well, we have abused it quite abit in the last couple of weeks we removed this stump last weekend mostly by hand and a sawzall with a diablo saw blade this shovel has a team mate that I found the Root slayer I would recommend both shovels because as a pair they will tackle most roots easily
customer_reviews.author: Carl  Fassnacht

customer_reviews.title: Murder those roots!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. My only change would be to make the top of the shovel blade a little wider/thicker for big feet to jump down on. It’s doable though for sure. Takes care of digging in rooted areas with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: M&ROlsen

customer_reviews.title: It should be called the Root ANNIHILATOR !!
customer_reviews.text: It uses lower body strength. I dug a trench through hard clay soil that was root bound with comparatively little effort. My husband and neighbor couldn’t believe that I could do it.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Asher

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: We do a lot of metal detecting, and this is the perfect size for that. We are very pleased with the sturdiness of this shovel. The size is perfect for planting bulbs and digging large hostas. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: kathleen wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Delivers as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: It really does deliver as advertised! It is fairly lightweight and perfect for removing old plants/roots from the garden. I was able to dig out last year's corn roots with no problem at all, whereas with a pitchfork it was a long and arduous process. The overgrown strawberries are next. Love it, and I'm so glad I saw the write up in Family Handyman that encouraged me to order.
customer_reviews.author: Cat lady

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love this shovel, perfect for my needs. I've been using it to dig a 2' deep trench for a bamboo shield, in tough rocky soil. It's in credibly strong with a welded steel handle and its triangular shape is perfect for loosening the rocks in the dirt. I use another rectangular trenching shovel to actually take the loose stuff out.
customer_reviews.author: Morrie

customer_reviews.title: Good design, poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: The shovel penetrates good but the tubing The handle is made of is too thin. bent the first time my wife tried to use it. she was digging up flowers. folded to handle right over. I would give it zero stars if there was that kind of rating available. so I'll just give it one star.
customer_reviews.author: delta mayham

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've already removed three small lightweight bushes with this with ease. larger ones are tougher, and it's more difficult if you're removing bushes from a rock garden. I've found that plunging the shovel into the middle of the bush, if possible, does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: best shovel
customer_reviews.text: I am in my 70's, and I removed and transplanted hostas with no problem. I didn't even have to push the shovel down with my foot, as I have bad feet. So happy I bought this. Remove rocks in ground with no problem. SHOULD HAVE BOUGHT THIS A LONG TIME AGO!!
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: WOW -IT REALLY WORKS AS ADVERTISED!!
customer_reviews.text: VERY HEAVY. IT SURE CAN DO THE JOB, HOWEVER. DON’T BUY IF YOU DON’T HAVE A GRANDKID AROUND TO TAKE OVER THE TASK, CAUSE THIS IS NO LIGHTWEIGHT “GRANNY” TOOL. IT WORKS JUST AS THE SELLER SAYS IT WILL.
customer_reviews.author: Just sayin’

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy and bends.
customer_reviews.text: The metal is too flimsy and bends with any resistance. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Terry C.

customer_reviews.title: very sharp
customer_reviews.text: Really does a good job ,but be careful I lost track of where the pvc for sprinkler was ...as I said it does a good job :) and I will learn a new task. By the way I'm 72 and a woman and I have been taking out very large bushes/trees with it . Crepe Mrytles by myself.
customer_reviews.author: cajoje

customer_reviews.title: Will terminate those roots!
customer_reviews.text: You will "dig" it!! This thing cuts through roots. Worth the money. Am glad I got the longer handle version. Light weight, but looks like it will hold up for years. So as a middle aged personal not accustomed to landscaping work, I've relocated several 4 four high trees the squirrels planted. Free trees! The old rose bushes with 1 " thorns are next.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic shovel
customer_reviews.text: This shovel is fantastic! We live in Texas with hard clay soil. We are in the process of cutting down and removing 10 year old pampas grass. We had no idea how we were going to remove the roots. Ordered this shovel in hope it would help us. All roots have been removed by my husband using this shovel! Great purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best garden tool purchases I have ever made. This tool is perfect for dividing perennials and getting rid of unwanted volunteer plants. I use it all the time. Will be buying this as Christmas gifts for the gardeners in my live
customer_reviews.author: V. King

customer_reviews.title: EASY weed removal!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool! "Pulling" weeds is so much easier than with the trowel I used to use. The dirt in my yard is pretty hard-packed and the Root Assassin breaks through the dirt SO easily. There are so many weeds in my neighborhood so I've been "gifted" with those same weeds in my yard. I highly recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Guy

customer_reviews.title: A refreshing idea in shovels!
customer_reviews.text: Ever need to plant near shrubbery or trees only to meet resistance because of roots? Need to dig a narrow ditch to lay pipe or wire? How about splitting sod or plants with intermingling roots in order to plant elsewhere or share with a friend? This is the shovel to use. It will make your work a lot easier & less irritating. Its unique blade has serrated edges to slice through smaller roots or saw through larger ones (within reason). It is definitely an advantage over regular shovels when there are root barriers. A great addition to your "arsenal"!
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Makes digging up unwanted plants sooooo easy!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Root Assassin, and I wouldn't buy anything else. The first one lasted 4 years until a guy hired to help me became over zealous in his digging- as in standing on it when he hit rock. Sigh. You will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Nashville Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Good Folks. Quality Product.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not much of a green thumb; however, coming from a beginner, the RA Shovel does indeed cut stringy roots easily. When you start getting into straw size (circumference) and bigger, you need to work a tad harde, but, it's not a big deal. The size and shape of the metal spade lets you dig from a few inches to one foot at a time. The height of the handle is perfect for me (5'10"), and the spade has a nice foot rest (?) for you to confidently apply pressure with no slippage. The product arrived in a timely and well packaged manner. I have no complaints, and would gladly order from these folks again.
customer_reviews.author: DaveBeeShure

customer_reviews.title: Maybe more than one purpose for this
customer_reviews.text: This is one mean shovel. It does exactly what the name implies. Also, after handling it a bit, it is possibly the most awesome home defense weapon on the planet, aside from a firearm. Unless the "bad guys" had guns, this thing would intimidate and cause major damage. It would also be difficult to take away from a defender.
customer_reviews.author: Hightailer

customer_reviews.title: I will continue to use a heavy duty shovel
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. It is light weight but is not as efficient in cutting some roots as I thought from reading the reviews and description. I would not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Digging and roots in the way.  No longer!  You'll love this but your roots won't!
customer_reviews.text: This is a longer version of the root cutter tools and is excellent for trenching and for digging in hard clay soil such as ours. Glad I got the set, as we are getting a little older and digging is getting a little tougher for us both. But with this and the root slayer, it's a bit easier on us and our backs. Glad I bought them
customer_reviews.author: DeepDishorThin

customer_reviews.title: Best little shovel ever!
customer_reviews.text: Where I live, it is nothing but shale. This little shovel went right through it with no problem. I gave it to my grandson, because he is the one that does my gardens for me and he has a little gardening business on the side. He was so grateful for it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Walizer

customer_reviews.title: I'd give it 10 stars if I could!!
customer_reviews.text: This makes short work of roots! This design is brilliant. It goes into the soil much easier than a regular shovel and the jagged edges with the poiint SHREDS the roots. The grip on the handle make very stable to use. I live next to a wooded area and have year-round weeds. I hate using chemicals so this is a good solution. Because the blade has a narrow profile, it's easy to get in tight spots between plants. I am 74 and for someone who's not as strong as they used to be, this will be a back saver.
customer_reviews.author: Babe1941 (Auntie B)

customer_reviews.title: the standard bog box shovel is a a much better purchase. I the side cutters are of no ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted so much for this to be a 5 star purchase but, considering the price and limited use, the standard bog box shovel is a a much better purchase. I the side cutters are of no real value, a pair of clippers are more useful for cutting any root that this shovel claims to be able to cut. as far as digging up plants (that are heavily rooted), if you put any amount of force on the shovel there is flex and it feels like it will want to bend or the shovel detach from the handle.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this shovel. My soil is clay and I often struggle to break the dirt. Not an issue with my little rotar rooter as I like to call it. Really well made. Cleans up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Emeraldgirl

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I confess that I had my doubts when I ordered this tool -- BUT after using it on several small-stump removals I must say that it works great, every bit as well as advertised. It also does a great job on transplanting too. The best way to use it, is to dig in a circle around the stump then use something else to pry the stump out -- a pick/mattock, long bar, whatever. This shovel will cut the roots (you may need to "saw" a bit on larger roots) but it will bend if you try to use it to pry things up.
customer_reviews.author: david d warner

customer_reviews.title: Depths are not marked on the shovel blade but measuring the placement of the the teeth prevents diggiing too shallow or too deep
customer_reviews.text: Now that I have had a chance to use the RAS, I am very pleased to say it does what I was hoping. I cuts through roots (as advertised) and makes a nice, and makes recovering the hole easy by making a nice, manageable plug. Great for uncovering and reburying buried utilities (of known depth and placement of course). Also excellent for transferring plants and shrubs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: My husband said he’s “pleasantly surprised “. He’s worried about the longevity and how well it will sharpen for future use. We used it on a cedar tree stump, and it has some minor damage to it. He will try and sharpen it to see if that will fix the damage. Hopefully it will, because it really helped on getting the stump out, but we have over 8 more stumps to remove. I’ll update later to let you know if it held up.
customer_reviews.author: M. Call

customer_reviews.title: It is great at cutting through really fibrous roots
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed -- for multiple projects. It is great at cutting through really fibrous roots, such as when I recently removed a two year old burning bush. It will be great for dividing perennials. I've also been using it to dig up suckers of bradford pear tree roots that have been popping up since I removed the trees (and had the stumps ground) two years ago.
customer_reviews.author: MAL

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves this "shovel"
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews so I made sure to tell my husband to NOT pull back on the "shovel" -to just use it to go up and down. We think the terminology - - "shovel" should be taken off the name of this - - -it should be root assassin saw - this might alleviate the misconception some people have.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie bresnyan

customer_reviews.title: Killer root elimination
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. Cuts through the toughest roots and will chop through large roots but by bit. I used it to cut roots for post holes where nothing else worked.
customer_reviews.author: The Renisaunce Man

customer_reviews.title: Shovel blade can (did) break off
customer_reviews.text: It took awhile but recently a company rep contacted me and offered a refund of the money for the shovel. I think the shovel is probably fine to good if used in an area with easy digging soil. It did not work for the location that I needed it; the shovel blade broke off. I am hopeful that the company will make the blade stronger. I do think the concept is great and the company good since they did follow-up with me about the performance of the shovel.
customer_reviews.author: TC Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, you won't regret
customer_reviews.text: I bought a post digger for planting. Big mistake. It failed. Twisted my shoulders.. This is so easy to use. Wish I had found this before wasting about $225.00
customer_reviews.author: B. George

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this! Very strong and sturdy. It's perfect for transplanting plants from one place to the next. It's also good for digging out deep rooted plants you no longer want in your garden. I have calla liliies that have taken over my garden. I used this tool to dig out many of the plants. I highly recommend this tool for anyone who neeeds to transplant or dig into your garden.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Dela Cruz

product_meta.title: ROOT ASSASSIN RA-001 Carbon Steel Shovel, 48-Inch, Red
product_meta.description: Size:48-InchIf you are looking for a durable multi-purpose gardening tool, the Root Assassin carbon steel shovel is exactly what you need. This garden shovel even has a lifetime replacement guarantee from the manufacturer to show you how confident they are in the performance of this Root Assassin shovel. Unlike your ordinary shovel, this root spade has a long and narrow blade with serrated edges to be versatile enough to fulfill your landscaping needs.
feature_bullets: The Root Assassin serrated shovel can help you accomplish various gardening tasks faster than other conventional gardening tools; The enhanced shovel shape and curved tip with serrated edges are perfect for slaying roots and weeds
The Root Assassin serrated shovel saw can effortlessly cut through roots and other obstructions in the soil
There is a sturdy D-shaped metal handle that is rubber coated for your digging comfort
Digging spade with a pointed tip that allows you to dig deeper with maximum leverage
Reliable Root Assassin carbon steel shovel with a lifetime replacement guarantee from the manufacturer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,207 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
